lines.text: [behind the lunch counter at the railroad yard, gum-chewing waitress Marie hears a train whistle - her cue to get ready to meet her boyfriend, Bill]

[taking off her apron]
Anything else you guys want?
Yeah, gimme a big slice a' you on toast, and some French-fried potatoes on the side.

[taking out her compact and powdering her face]
Listen, baby, I'm A.P.O.

[to the other railroad worker]
What does she mean, A.P.O.?
Ain't Puttin' Out! Besides, I'm Bill White's girl, and I'm a one-man woman.
That's a hot one, Marie.
Whattaya mean "that's a hot one"?
Didn't I see you down ta Fishbeck's Dance Hall with Elmer Brown?
Oh yeah. Elmer's a kind of a cousin of mine.
Oh! Some cousins are sure affectionate.
Nevertheless, he's my distant cousin.
That's her story, and she's gonna stick to it.
It's the story Bill's gonna hear unless you guys do some broadcasting of your own.
Well, don't worry. Not me. I ain't gonna get in no trouble.

[walking toward the door]
Then stop shootin' off your big mouth.
Hey Marie. Wouldja gimme a flock a' donuts with small holes?

[at the door, hand on hip]
If there're any small holes around here, I'll eat 'em myself.
[the men laugh as she leaves the diner]

[eying up his girl before they go out on the dance floor]
Babe, you look like $700 tonight, I'm tellin' you! Come on, let's go!
[repeated line]

[while offering a stick of chewing gum]
Have a little chew on me...
I stopped seeing what there was to see!

[Slapping the more-than-ample derriere of the waitress while her back is turned]
How are you, Davenport?
You stop callin' me that! Honest to goodness, you're gettin' something fierce!
Hog wild, Baby, and no foolin'. Scramble three and a cup of jamocha.

[Yelling to the cook offscreen]
Scramble three in a hurry - it's Bill White!
[to Bill]
Bread or toast or maybe you'd like a bun?

[Implying a double entendre]
No, had one last night.
Pig-Leg.
Peg-Leg.
Pig-Leg
Peg-Leg!
All right, maybe I'm wrong.
Sweet peas? Gee, that'll be swell.
Say, I think you're the swellest girl in the world.
Oh, you're a dear. And just for that I'm gonna give you a little kiss.
You've got to tell a good-guy the truth, no matter how much it burns him up.
I love you, Lily. And I want ya. And if you are here or near me, I'll take you. You understand? I'll take you.
I know where I can get you a little slug of gin.
I don't think so.
You don't want to drink?
No, I quit a long time ago.
Oh, some dame made you swear off, huh?
Hey, this is like old times. You and me neckin' and you gettin' plastered.
Say, I ain't plastered.
I didn't say you was. I said - *gettin'*!
I thought of somethin'.
Impossible!
What?
Possible.
Here we are, moonin' around cause we split up, when we can get married tonight, if we want.
Say, you're a great girl.
[Slaps her in the face]
You got some - great ideas.
Are you game?
He's blind. Stone blind.
Aw, buck up, fella. I know its pretty tough for your side-kick. You're takin' it too hard.
